result.execSummary:
The defendant Chad M Havens was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • False Imprisonment [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.30.
  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
On Case #15CF368-Count #1, the Court sentences Mr. Havens to  5 years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of 2 years, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 3 years.  This sentence is concurrent with any sentence in being. 

The Court STAYS all of these sentences and places Mr. Havens on Probation for three years.

miscConds.notes:
--to pay costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, to include the DNA surcharges, and to include the Domestic Abuse Surcharge in Case #15CF368

--in Case15CF368: to pay $49 subpoena fees

--no possession or consumption of alcohol

--no presence in bars, taverns, liquor stores

--no possession or consumption of illegal drugs

--contact with Monica Gomez is only allowed if Ms. Gomez, the Agent, and the treatment providers agree

--no acts or threats of violence

--to undergo any other type of assessment, treatment, or counseling as required by the Agent

--to be subject to SCRAM or Sobrietor or Soberlink being installed prior to Mr. Havens' release from jail; this monitoring is to remain in place for the first sixty days after release from custody unless otherwise modified/approved by the Court

--to take all prescribed medications only as prescribed

--to undergo mental health treatment as required by the Agent

--to undergo and complete Certified Batterers' Intervention programming

--to comply with DNA sample provision upon demand

Arresting Agency: Waterloo PD

If probation, parole or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of the victim(s) and government entities for the balance due.
--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with treatment recommendations

timeConds.notes:
--on Case #368-Count #1 only: to serve six months in the Jefferson County Jail with work-release privileges commencing forthwith; work release may be for employment, alcohol/other drug treatment and counseling, and for medical appointments-- subject to the Sheriff's Huber Release rules

Defendant is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence with absolute sobriety and without non-prescribed controlled substances in his/her system.  Non-compliance will result in loss of Huber/work-release privileges without further process.

supervisions.notes:
On Case #15CF368-Count #2, the Court sentences Mr. Havens to 6 months Jail, to be served in the Wisconsin State Prison System concurrent with Count #1.

The Court STAYS all of these sentences and places Mr. Havens on Probation for three years with conditions.

[MK] cases #15CF368, #15CF441, #16CF1, #16CF88, and #16CF214 called at 8:51am. 
Defendant Chad M Havens in court, in custody, with Attorney Jeffrey J De La Rosa.  ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.
The Court reviews the Criminal Case Settlement form, verifying that Mr. Havens understands and joins in the agreement.

On oral Motion of the State, the Court amends Count #4 of Case #16CF214 to modify the Charge from Obstructing to Resisting.  The charge is recited as: Class A Misdemeanor Resisting an Officer with a Dangerous Weapon. [Clerk's added note: there is no modification to the subject statute numbers.]
   
Constitutional rights reviewed; pleas of " Guilty " entered on Case #15CF368-Counts #1 & #2,  on Case #15CF441-Counts #3 & #5, on Case #16CF88-Count #1, on Case #16CF214-Counts #2 & #4; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified (ADA Hall files the Victim Impact Statement in Case #15CF368); the Court accepts the pleas, finds Mr. Havens guilty, and orders Judgments of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Case #16CF1 and the remaining counts on the other files.


On Case #15CF368-Count #1, the Court sentences Mr. Havens to  5 years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of 2 years, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 3 years.  This sentence is conconcurrent with any sentence in being. 
On Case #15CF368-Count #2, the Court sentences Mr. Havens to 6 months Jail, to be served in the Wisconsin State Prison System concurrent with Count #1.

On Case #15CF441-Count #3, the Court sentences Mr. Havens to  5 years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of 2 years, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 3 years.  This sentence is concurrent with Case #15CF368 and with any sentence in being.
On Case #15CF441-Count #5, the Court sentences Mr. Havens to six months Jail, to be served in the Wisconsin State Prison System concurrent with Count #3.

On Case #16CF88-Count #1, the Court sentences Mr. Havens to  5 years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of 2 years, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 3 years.  This sentence is concurrent with Cases #15CF368 and #15CF441 and with any sentence in being.

On Case #16CF214-Count #2, the Court sentences Mr. Havens to  5 years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of 2 years, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 3 years.  This sentence is concurrent with Cases #15CF368 and #15CF441 and #16CF88 and with any sentence in being.
On Case #16CF214-Count #4, the Court sentences Mr. Havens to six months Jail, to be served in the Wisconsin State Prison System concurrent with Count #2.

The Court finds that the Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program "Boot Camp".
The Court finds that the Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.
The Court gives  0 days credit for time already served. The Defense may submit a stipulation or request regarding sentence credit; this is to be filed within one week.

The Court STAYS all of these sentences and places Mr. Havens on Probation for three years with conditions. 
--on Case #368-Count #1 only: to serve six months in the Jefferson County Jail with work-release privileges commencing forthwith; work release may be for employment, alcohol/other drug treatment and counseling, and for medical appointments-- subject to the Sheriff's Huber Release rules
--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with treatment recommendations
--to undergo any other type of assessment, treatment, or counseling as required by the Agent
--no possession of any dangerous weapon
--to be subject to SCRAM or Sobrietor or Soberlink being installed prior to Mr. Havens' release from jail; this monitoring is to remain in place for the first sixty days after release from custody unless otherwise modified/approved by the Court
--no possession or consumption of alcohol
--no presence in bars, taverns, liquor stores
--no possession or consumption of illegal drugs
--to take all prescribed medications only as prescribed
--to undergo mental health treatment as required by the Agent
--to undergo and complete Certified Batterers' Intervention programming
--contact with Monica Gomez is only allowed if Ms. Gomez, the Agent, and the treatment providers agree
--no acts or threats of violence
--to comply with DNA sample provision upon demand
--to pay costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, to include the DNA surcharges, and to include the Domestic Abuse Surcharge in Case #15cF368; the State is granted one week to submit any recoverable prosecution- costs request, to be submitted on a 5-day objection basis; the Judgment of Conviction(s) will be amended accordingly unless the Defense objects;  if no additional costs are requested, then the statutory costs otherrwise stands
